item.title: Configuring SSH Keys on Windows and Linux: A Practical Guide
item.description: Enable SSH Connection with Public Key on Windows and Linux Servers Use the public key located in the user’s folder on Windows The SSH public key on Windows can be found at the following path: C:UsersYourUser.sshid_rsa.pub If there is no key, you will need to generate one. Generate an SSH key on the local machine Open PowerShell and run the following command to generate a new SSH key: ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 Copy the public key to the server To copy the public key to the server, you can use the following command:
